docblock.description: Thrown when an API call returns an exception.
The result from the API server that represents the exception information.
Make a new API Exception with the given result.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The result from the API server

docblock.description: Return the associated result object returned by the API server.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The result from the API server

docblock.description: Returns the associated type for the error.
docblock.long-description: This will default to 'Exception' when a type is not available.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The string representation of the error

docblock.description: Provides access to the Facebook Platform.
docblock.long-description: This class provides a majority of the functionality needed, but the class is abstract because it is designed to be sub-classed. The subclass must implement the four abstract methods listed at the bottom of the file.

docblock.description: List of query parameters that get automatically dropped when rebuilding the current URL.
The ID of the Facebook user, or 0 if the user is logged out.
The data from the signed_request token.
A CSRF state variable to assist in the defense against CSRF attacks.
The OAuth access token received in exchange for a valid authorization code.
docblock.long-description: null means the access token has yet to be determined.

docblock.description: Indicates if the CURL based @ syntax for file uploads is enabled.
Indicates if we trust HTTP_X_FORWARDED_* headers.

docblock.long-description: The configuration: - appId: the application ID - secret: the application secret - fileUpload: (optional) boolean indicating if file uploads are enabled

docblock.description: Set the file upload support status.
Get the file upload support status.

tag.name: return
tag.description: true if and only if the server supports file upload.

docblock.long-description: Get the file upload support status.

tag.name: return
tag.description: true if and only if the server supports file upload.

docblock.description: Sets the access token for api calls.
docblock.long-description: Use this if you get your access token by other means and just want the SDK to use it.

docblock.description: Extend an access token, while removing the short-lived token that might have been generated via client-side flow.
docblock.long-description: Thanks to http://bit.ly/b0Pt0H for the workaround.

docblock.description: Determines the access token that should be used for API calls.
docblock.long-description: The first time this is called, $this->accessToken is set equal to either a valid user access token, or it's set to the application access token if a valid user access token wasn't available. Subsequent calls return whatever the first call returned.

docblock.description: Determines and returns the user access token, first using the signed request if present, and then falling back on the authorization code if present.
docblock.long-description: The intent is to return a valid user access token, or false if one is determined to not be available.

tag.name: return
tag.description: A valid user access token, or false if one could not be determined.

docblock.description: Retrieve the signed request, either from a request parameter or, if not present, from a cookie.

tag.name: return
tag.description: the signed request, if available, or null otherwise.

docblock.description: Get the UID of the connected user, or 0 if the Facebook user is not connected.
Determines the connected user by first examining any signed requests, then considering an authorization code, and then falling back to any persistent store storing the user.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The id of the connected Facebook user, or 0 if no such user exists.

docblock.description: Get a Login URL for use with redirects.
docblock.long-description:
By default, full page redirect is assumed. If you are using the generated URL with a window.open() call in JavaScript, you can pass in display=popup as part of the $params.

The parameters: - redirect_uri: the url to go to after a successful login - scope: comma separated list of requested extended perms

tag.name: return
tag.description: The URL for the login flow

docblock.description: Get a Logout URL suitable for use with redirects.
docblock.long-description: The parameters: - next: the url to go to after a successful logout

tag.name: return
tag.description: The URL for the logout flow

docblock.description: Get a login status URL to fetch the status from Facebook.
docblock.long-description: The parameters: - ok_session: the URL to go to if a session is found - no_session: the URL to go to if the user is not connected - no_user: the URL to go to if the user is not signed into facebook

tag.name: return
tag.description: The URL for the logout flow

docblock.description: Constructs and returns the name of the cookie that potentially houses the signed request for the app user.
docblock.long-description: The cookie is not set by the BaseFacebook class, but it may be set by the JavaScript SDK.

tag.name: return
tag.description: the name of the cookie that would house the signed request value.

docblock.description: Constructs and returns the name of the coookie that potentially contain metadata.
docblock.long-description: The cookie is not set by the BaseFacebook class, but it may be set by the JavaScript SDK.

tag.name: return
tag.description: the name of the cookie that would house metadata.

docblock.description: Get the authorization code from the query parameters, if it exists, and otherwise return false to signal no authorization code was discoverable.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The authorization code, or false if the authorization code could not be determined.

docblock.description: Retrieves the UID with the understanding that $this->accessToken has already been set and is seemingly legitimate.
docblock.long-description: It relies on Facebook's Graph API to retrieve user information and then extract the user ID.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the UID of the Facebook user, or 0 if the Facebook user could not be determined.

docblock.description: Returns the access token that should be used for logged out users when no authorization code is available.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The application access token, useful for gathering public information about users and applications.

docblock.description: Lays down a CSRF state token for this process.
Retrieves an access token for the given authorization code (previously generated from www.facebook.com on behalf of a specific user).
docblock.long-description: The authorization code is sent to graph.facebook.com and a legitimate access token is generated provided the access token and the user for which it was generated all match, and the user is either logged in to Facebook or has granted an offline access permission.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An access token exchanged for the authorization code, or false if an access token could not be generated.

docblock.description: Return true if this is video post.

tag.name: return
tag.description: true if this is video post

docblock.long-description: This method can be overridden by subclasses if developers want to do fancier things or use something other than curl to make the request.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The URL to make the request to

tag.name: param
tag.description: The parameters to use for the POST body

docblock.description: Parses a signed_request and validates the signature.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The payload inside it or null if the sig is wrong

docblock.description: Makes a signed_request blob using the given data.
Build the URL for api given parameters.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The URL for the given parameters

docblock.description: Build the URL for given domain alias, path and parameters.

tag.name: param
tag.description: string The name of the domain

tag.name: param
tag.description: string Optional path (without a leading slash)

tag.name: return
tag.description: The URL for the given parameters

docblock.description: Get the base domain used for the cookie.
Returns the Current URL, stripping it of known FB parameters that should not persist.
Returns true if and only if the key or key/value pair should be retained as part of the query string.
docblock.long-description: This amounts to a brute-force search of the very small list of Facebook-specific params that should be stripped out.

tag.name: param
tag.description: A key or key/value pair within a URL's query (e.g. 'foo=a', 'foo=', or 'foo'.

docblock.description: Analyzes the supplied result to see if it was thrown because the access token is no longer valid.
docblock.long-description: If that is the case, then we destroy the session.

tag.name: param
tag.description: array A record storing the error message returned by a failed API call.

docblock.description: Prints to the error log if you aren't in command line mode.
Base64 encoding that doesn't need to be urlencode()ed.
docblock.long-description: Exactly the same as base64_encode except it uses - instead of + _ instead of / No padded =

docblock.description: Base64 encoding that doesn't need to be urlencode()ed.
docblock.long-description: Exactly the same as base64_encode except it uses - instead of + _ instead of /

docblock.description: Parses the metadata cookie that our Javascript API set
Stores the given ($key, $value) pair, so that future calls to getPersistentData($key) return $value.
docblock.long-description: This call may be in another request.

docblock.description: Get the data for $key, persisted by BaseFacebook::setPersistentData()

tag.name: param
tag.description: The key of the data to retrieve

tag.name: param
tag.description: The default value to return if $key is not found

docblock.description: Clear the data with $key from the persistent storage
Clear all data from the persistent storage

docblock.description: Extends the BaseFacebook class with the intent of using PHP sessions to store user ids and access tokens.
Identical to the parent constructor, except that we start a PHP session to store the user ID and access token if during the course of execution we discover them.

tag.name: param
tag.description: the application configuration. Additionally accepts "sharedSession" as a boolean to turn on a secondary cookie for environments with a shared session (that is, your app shares the domain with other apps).

docblock.description: Provides the implementations of the inherited abstract methods.
docblock.long-description: The implementation uses PHP sessions to maintain a store for authorization codes, user ids, CSRF states, and access tokens.

docblock.description: enable_parser Should be parser be used or the view files just loaded normally?
enable_parser_body Should be parser be used or the body view files just loaded normally?
theme_locations List the locations where themes may be stored
add_theme_location Set another location for themes to be looked in
theme_exists Check if a theme exists
get_layouts Get all current layouts (if using a theme you'll get a list of theme layouts)
get_layouts Get all current layouts (if using a theme you'll get a list of theme layouts)
layout_exists Check if a theme layout exists
